qas.question: What is the main component of the qualitative judgment definition of literature?

answers.text: writing that possesses high quality or distinction

qas.question: What French term for value-based literature literally translates as "fine writing?"
Encyclopedia Britannica defined literature in its 1911 editions how?

answers.text: "the best expression of the best thought reduced to writing."

qas.question: What effect does the evolving definition of literature have?

answers.text: anything which is universally regarded as literature has the potential to be excluded

qas.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish term, "belles-lettres?"

plausible_answers.text: the best expression of the best thought reduced to writing.

qas.question: How does the Encyclopedia Britannia Tenth Edition classify literature?
Value-decisions can do what over time?
What years does the Encyclopedia Brittanica Tenth Edition cover?

plausible_answers.text: The value judgement definition of literature considers it to exclusively include writing that possesses high quality or distinction

qas.question: What forms part of the so-called belles-lettres law?

plausible_answers.text: the best expression of the best thought reduced to writing

qas.question: How does the 1901 Encyclopedia Britannica define "literature?"
In what way can value-judgments not change?
Which edition of the World Book Encyclopedia uses the value judgment definition of "literature?"
When was the definition of value judgement first used?
What tradition does the value judgement definition form all of?
What year was the Eleventh Edition of Encyclopedia Britannica written?

context: <b8_0>The value judgement definition of literature considers it to exclusively include <a0_0>writing that possesses high quality or distinction<b8_0/><a0_0/>, forming part of the so-called <a1_0><b9_0><b14_0>belles-lettres<b9_0/><a1_0/> ('<b4_0>fine writing<b4_0/>') tradition<b14_0/>. This is the definition used in the Encyclopædia Britannica <b12_0>Eleventh Edition<b12_0/> <b7_0><b13_0>(<b15_0>1910<b15_0/>–11<b7_0/>)<b13_0/> when it classifies literature as <a2_0>"<b5_0><b10_0>the best expression of the best thought reduced to writing<b10_0/>.<b5_0/>"<a2_0/> However, this has the result that there is no objective definition of what constitutes "literature"; anything can be literature, and <a3_0>anything which is universally regarded as literature has the potential to be excluded<a3_0/>, since value-judgements can <b6_0>change<b6_0/> <b11_0><b16_0>over time<b16_0/><b11_0/>.
